org.jcp.jsr94.tck
Class RuleExecutionSetMetadataTest

java.lang.Object
  |

        |
        +--junit.framework.TestCase
              |
              +--org.jcp.jsr94.tck.RuleExecutionSetMetadataTest
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class RuleExecutionSetMetadataTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase

Test the javax.rules.RuleExecutionSetMetadata class.

Perfoms the following tests:

  • Basic API tests. testRuleExecutionSetMetadata()
    • Retrieve Metadata
    • Verify URI
    • Verify name
Note:
This test uses a RuleSetExecution definition that is stored in the tck_res_1.xml. You have to change this file accoding to your rule execution set definition. The mainline TCK documentation describes the contents of this rule execution set definition.

Since:
JSR-94 1.0
Version:
1.0
See Also:
RuleExecutionSetMetadata

testRuleExecutionSetMetadata

public void testRuleExecutionSetMetadata()
Test the compliance for javax.rules.RuleExecutionSetMetadata.

Description:
Create a stateless rule session and retrieve the rule execution set metadata. Determine the name and uri of this metadata.

  • Retrieve Metadata
    • Fail: If the rule execution set metadata cannot be retrieved from the rule session.
    • Succeed: If a non null RuleExecutionSetMetadata is retrieved.
  • Verify URI
    • Fail: If uri is not the same as specified during the binding of the rule execution set.
    • Succeed: If uri corresponds with the internal given binding.
  • Verify name
    • Fail: If name is null.
    • Succeed: If the metadata has a non null name.
See Also:
TestCaseUtil.getStatelessRuleSession(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
